step1.sentence: The washing machine broke down the morning before her family was due to arrive.

step2.story: Their car broke down on the motorway during a rainstorm. They sat inside waiting for the tow truck, watching cars splash past in the dark.

step3.story: The office printer broke down on the day of the most important client presentation. The team tried restarting it, clearing the paper jam, and unplugging it twice. Nothing worked. With thirty minutes to spare, one colleague emailed the files to a print shop down the street. Another ran there and came back with the pages still warm. The presentation went ahead without anyone in the audience knowing.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 기계나 장치 등이 작동을 멈추고 고장나다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 차, 컴퓨터, 가전제품 등이 갑자기 작동을 멈출 때 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: break(부서지다)와 down(아래로, 기능 정지)이 결합하여 기능이 무너진다는 의미가 되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 기계 고장뿐 아니라 대화가 결렬되거나 감정이 무너지는 상황에도 씁니다. 문맥으로 구분합니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: My laptop broke down right before the deadline and I lost everything.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 마감 직전에 노트북이 고장났고 모든 게 사라졌어요.
